name: Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
author: Healthy Eats Helen
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a bowl, combine oats, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
In a separate large bowl, cream together butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in egg and vanilla extract until well combined.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Stir in raisins.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
Cool on wire racks before serving.

name: Garlic Parmesan Roasted Brussels Sprouts
author: Chef John Doe
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Spread them on a baking sheet and roast for 25 minutes.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and roast for an additional 5 minutes.

name: Vegetarian Chickpea Curry
author: Chef Alex
ingredients: 2 cans (400g each) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
steps: In a pan, sauté diced onions until softened. Add minced garlic and cook for an additional minute.
Stir in chopped tomatoes, curry powder, cumin, and turmeric. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add chickpeas and coconut milk. Simmer for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve over cooked basmati rice and garnish with fresh cilantro.

name: Baked Salmon with Lemon Dill Sauce
author: Chef Sophia
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet. Season with salt, pepper, and dried dill. Drizzle with olive oil.
Top each fillet with lemon slices. Bake for 20 minutes or until salmon is cooked through.
In a bowl, mix Greek yogurt and Dijon mustard to prepare the sauce. Serve salmon with the sauce and garnish with chopped parsley.

name: Banana Bread
author: Grandma Grace
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in mashed bananas and vanilla extract.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, alternating with buttermilk. Begin and end with the dry ingredients.
Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan. Bake for 60-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow the banana bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Lemon Herb Quinoa Salad
author: Chef Jane Smith
steps: In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and parsley.
Add lemon zest and juice, tossing to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Mushroom and Spinach Stuffed Chicken
author: Chef Lisa
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix chopped spinach, sliced mushrooms, mozzarella cheese, minced garlic, and dried oregano.
Carefully butterfly each chicken breast and stuff with the spinach-mushroom mixture. Season with salt and pepper.
In an oven-safe skillet, heat olive oil. Sear stuffed chicken breasts until golden brown on both sides.
Pour chicken broth into the skillet and transfer it to the preheated oven. Bake for 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

name: Mushroom and Spinach Quesadillas
author: Chef Carlos
ingredients: Salsa and sour cream for serving
steps: In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their moisture.
Add fresh spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted. Season with cumin and chili powder.
Place a tortilla in the skillet, add a portion of the mushroom and spinach mixture, and sprinkle with shredded Monterey Jack cheese. Top with another tortilla.
Cook on both sides until the tortilla is golden and the cheese is melted.
Repeat with the remaining tortillas. Serve with salsa and sour cream.

name: Pasta Aglio e Olio
author: Chef Marco
steps: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Reserve a cup of pasta water before draining.
In a pan, sauté thinly sliced garlic and red pepper flakes in olive oil until garlic is golden but not browned.
Add cooked spaghetti to the pan, tossing to coat with the garlic-infused oil. If needed, add reserved pasta water to achieve desired consistency.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve with grated Parmesan cheese.

name: Teriyaki Salmon Bowl
author: Chef Hiro
ingredients: Sesame seeds and green onions for garnish
steps: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, and grated ginger to create the teriyaki sauce.
Marinate salmon fillets in half of the teriyaki sauce for at least 10 minutes.
Pan-sear or grill salmon until cooked to your liking.
Serve salmon over cooked brown rice, topped with steamed broccoli, julienned carrots, and a drizzle of the remaining teriyaki sauce. Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions.

name: Roasted Sweet Potato Wedges
author: Chef Alex Johnson
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, cut into wedges
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Toss sweet potato wedges with olive oil, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 30 minutes, turning halfway through.

name: Creamy Garlic Mashed Cauliflower
author: Chef Emily Davis
ingredients: 1 large head of cauliflower, cut into florets
steps: Steam cauliflower until tender, about 15 minutes.
In a blender, combine cauliflower, garlic, butter, and heavy cream. Blend until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: Baker Betty
ingredients: 2 cups semisweet and/or milk chocolate chips
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a small bowl, whisk together the flour and baking soda.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and salt until light and fluffy.
Add vanilla extract and eggs; beat well.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool on wire racks before serving.

name: Vegetarian Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers
author: Chef Olivia
ingredients: 4 bell peppers, halved and seeds removed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each bell pepper half with the quinoa mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes or until peppers are tender.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve.

name: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
author: Chef Maria
steps: Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Pour in the heavy cream, bring to a simmer, and then stir in grated Parmesan cheese until melted.
Add sliced chicken to the sauce and let it simmer for a few minutes until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the Alfredo sauce over cooked fettuccine pasta. Garnish with chopped parsley.

name: Strawberry Shortcake
author: Chef Carla
ingredients: 1 pound fresh strawberries, hulled and sliced
steps: In a bowl, combine sliced strawberries and granulated sugar. Let sit for 15 minutes.
In a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream until soft peaks form.
Add powdered sugar and vanilla extract to whipped cream; continue whipping until stiff peaks form.
Place a spoonful of strawberries on the bottom half of each shortcake.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream and place the other half of the shortcake on top.
Garnish with additional strawberries and serve immediately.

name: Caprese Skewers
author: Chef Michael Rodriguez
steps: Thread a cherry tomato, a mozzarella ball, and a basil leaf onto small skewers.
Arrange on a serving platter and drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving.

name: Vanilla Pudding Parfait
author: Pastry Chef Paul
steps: In a saucepan, whisk together milk, sugar, cornstarch, and salt.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens and comes to a boil.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract. Allow the pudding to cool slightly.
In serving glasses, layer the vanilla pudding with whipped cream. Repeat the layers.
Top with crushed cookies if desired.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
Coat chicken breasts with the marinade and grill for 10-12 minutes, turning once, until fully cooked.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.
name: Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken
author: Chef Henry
